title: Consumers with a newspaper or magazine subscriptions in the U.S. 2017 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 5 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Retirees and lowest at Response Millennials.
There is a difference of 21.0 between the maximum Response Retirees and minimum Response Millennials.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 5 number of Responses.
Response Retirees has the highest Share of respondents and Millennials has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 5 number of Responses.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Retirees and lowest at Response Millennials.
There is a difference of 21.0 between the maximum Response Retirees and minimum Response Millennials.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Retirees has the highest Share of respondents and Millennials has the lowest Share of respondents.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Response Boomers.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 21.0.
Share of respondents at Response Retirees is 54.0 , second place is Boomers at 45.0, and thirdly is Total at 41.0.
The lowest value 33.0 at Millennials is almost 1.3 times smaller than the average value 41.6.
The Share of respondents is 208.0 if we add up values of all Responses.
